result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:01 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court for Matthew R Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Adams advises parties have resolved the matter.  State confirms and moves to amend Counts 2 & 4 to County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct, 13-102(c)(8), without the DV enhancer, Counts 1 & 3 are to be dismissed and read in and they will leave the fine amount up to the Court.  Atty. Adams will accept the amendment to Counts 2 & 4 on behalf of his client and enters a no contest plea to Counts 2 & 4.  Court will accept the no contest plea and find the defendant guilty to the Amended Counts 2 & 4 and will order Counts 1 & 3 be dismissed and read in.


COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $330.50;
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.


COUNT 4:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $330.50;
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:25 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew R Scott not in court.  Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court for Matthew R Scott. Atty. Adams requests his client's appearance be waived for today only as his client contacted him last night to advise that due to illness he was not able to appear for court today.  Atty. Adams does note that his client was able to complete his Domestic Abuse counseling and filed proof of that in the case.  Atty. Adams is requesting a short adjournment for plea and sentencing in a couple of weeks.  State has no objection to the request.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a capias until the next court date.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing in the next 2-3 weeks.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Certificate of Completion of DV treatment program.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:39 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Matthew R Scott in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Adams provides an update, his client needs additional time to complete counseling which should occur in September.  Atty. Adams requests the matter be set for projected plea and setencing in September.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:25 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Matthew R Scott in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Adams advises an amended complaint has been filed, he acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea.  Court confirms the Amended Complaint has been filed and received.  Atty. Adams is looking for another further proceedings date in about 60 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant allowed one visit to the residence with law enforcement present to obtain his personal possessions.

01:55 PM Defendant Matthew R Scott in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
